newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-FRANCE SELLS TYCOON TAPIE'S YACHT FOR $6 MLN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FRANCE SELLS TYCOON TAPIE'S YACHT FOR $6 MLN.

text.p: The majestic four-masted yacht in which French tycoon Bernard Tapie sailed into trouble over taxes is being sold by court order for $6 million, barely half the asking price.
Tapie renovated the 74-metre (240 foot) Phocea at great expense and it symbolised his luxurious lifestyle at the height of his fame and power.
But he was convicted for fraudulently passing off the costs as business expenses and received a six-month sentence for tax evasion.
The Marseille law firm of Cabinet Pierrel et Juramec, who were instructed to sell the boat by a Paris court, had hoped for a price of 70 million to 100 million francs ($12 million to $17 million).
They said on Wednesday they had negotiated a sale for 36.5 million francs to Tranquil Limited, a private Virgin Islands company, which will be final in eight days if the court approves.
